sub_title: Product Engineer at ICN8 waferfab at NXP Semiconductors
summary:
• Organized professional, pro-active and results driven with ability to work in both an R&D and manufacturing environment
• Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering, 20+ years of experience in semiconductor industry
• Six Sigma certifications: Lean thinking, Black Belt for Industry
• Team worker with good communication skills (across multiple levels)
• Ability to lead and drive cost reduction and yield enhancement programs

Specialties: • Industrial projects, volume ramp-up, yield improvement, test time reduction
• Statistical data analysis, product capability, process capability, MSA, gauge R&R, Cp, Cpk
• Statistical process control (SPC), control charts & OCAP, defective rate (PPM), design of experiments (DOE)
• Disciplined problem solving (8D), Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (FMEA), TQM tools
• Proficient in Microsoft office and data analysis software (DATA-Power, Minitab)

profile_positions.description:
• Responsible for product introductions in A-BCDx products.

• Started Geen Belt project: Yield improvement of C18shrink product. The goal is to understand the random yield loss, accelerate the yield learning and enable baseline yield improvements. Plan to reach C-phase in week 1310

• Completed the course: IC physics devices and processing (The High Tech Institute)
profile_positions.title: Product Engineer at ICN8 waferfab

profile_positions.title: Product Engineer (at MST Portable Power Solutions)

profile_positions.description:
Established in 2006, former Semiconductors division of Royal Philips Electronics
Job description did not change, see below…

During the PE job at Philips and NXP I was also Project Leader for some small Industrial Projects:
•	Package transfer until production release
•	IC redesign (metal fix) until tape-out
•	Volume ramp-up PCF50635 (PMU)
•	Volume ramp-up PCF50623 (PMU)

Followed training in:
•	Organizing and Working in a Project
•	Communication and Collaboration
•	Organizational Management
•	QMS Internal Auditor Training Course
•	Reliability Foundation & Applied Reliability
profile_positions.title: Product Engineer (at MST Portable Power Solutions)

profile_positions.description:
Job Responsibilities: 
•	As part of new product introduction evaluate the product performance to specifications
•	Monitor initial product yield and drive cost reduction and yield enhancement programs
•	As team member responsible for product release, volume ramp-up and coordination of  activities to meet scheduled milestones
•	Determine root causes of nonconforming products and implement actions to eliminate defects and nonconforming material
•	As part of sustaining activities address customer complaints and mitigating potential quality issues

For my work on customer complaint handling I received 3 recognition awards:
•	Presented on 8 March 2004 “in recognition of his excellent contribution to solving Samsung's PCF50601 SIM issue and bringing the PPM down to an acceptable level.”
•	Presented on 10 October 2005 (as group member) “in recognition for taking the extra mile in the field of handling customer complaints, thereby achieving the extraordinary result with making BL Cellular Systems best in class on both the throughput time and the PPM level.”
•	Presented on 13 August 2007 “in recognition of his excellent contribution to the ongoing satisfaction of our customers through his dedicated work on PCF50635 customer complaints.”

Job Experience:
•	Qualification, yield analysis and documentation to release new products
•	Identify, analyze, and resolve yield limiting factors by identifying root causes and implementing improvements 
•	Ability to lead and drive cost reduction and yield enhancement programs (margin plans)
•	Ability to lead and drive multi-functional teams (industrial projects)
profile_positions.title: Product Engineer (at BL Cellular Systems)

profile_positions.description:
Job Responsibilities: 
•	Provide technical support for released products and address yield enhancement opportunities
•	Collect, analyze and use test data to improve yields (product capability)
•	Maximize yield by reducing product's sensitivity to process variation (process capability)
•	Interface with Operations Group, Equipment Engineering and other engineering groups to address cross-functional yield and quality challenges

Job Experience:
•	Experience with Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (FMEA)
•	Electrical test experience (parametric PCM, die sort ATE)
•	Experience data interpretation using statistical methods and analysis 
•	Familiar with DfT (Design for Testability) and DfM (Design for Manufacturability)
•	Familiar with Failure Analysis techniques
profile_positions.title: Yield & Product Engineer (at Wafer FAB)

profile_positions.description:
Job Responsibilities: 
•	Responsible for thin film process equipment for PVD (sputtering), CVD and PECVD
•	Monitor tool- and yield-performance and identify trends
•	Improve reliability, quality and machine up-time
•	Work closely with senior scientists and engineering staff to conduct designed experiments to understand manufacturing processes and improve efficiencies

Job Experience:
•	Process experience with PVD and (PE) CVD equipment
•	Familiar with associated metrology tools
•	Experience with statistical process control (SPC) and design of experiments (DOE)
•	Analytical skills and experience with disciplined problem solving process (8D)
•	Experience with (high) vacuum process equipment
profile_positions.title: Process Equipment Engineer (shift technician)
